column2:
COVID-19 negative certification not required / not known
Marshall Islands authorities have introduced a number of precautionary measures, including a total suspension of international travellers coming into RMI.
column3:
Quarantine requirement:
Check with your travel company for the latest information, including on quarantine requirements.
column5:
Latest News:

International Restrictions:
*Entry rules in response to coronavirus (COVID-19): A total suspension of international travellers coming to the Marshall Islands continues and commercial flights to and from the islands remain very limited. There is a small number of repatriation flights. Check with your travel company for the latest information, including on quarantine requirements.

Internal Restrictions:
*Travel in the Marshall Islands: Domestic air travel (on international airlines) and sea travel between Majuro and Kwajalein is not permitted. Travel between islands may be further limited due to the current outbreak of COVID-19.
*Public places and services: Following an increase in the number of COVID-19 cases, President Kabua declared a State of Health Disaster on 12 August 2022. No lockdown has been introduced but mask-wearing has now been mandated. Public services remain open but there may be some disruption due to staff absences caused by COVID-19. You should follow advice from the local authorities on avoiding the spread of COVID-19, isolation and testing.
*If you test positive for COVID-19, you may need to stay where you are until you test negative. You may also need to seek treatment there.
column6: US State Dept. COVID-19 Country Specific Information/ Foreign travel advice, Gov.UK/ OSAC Travel Advisories/
